intro: Oxylobium spathulatum, commonly known as the broadleaf oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy areas or along stream banks. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
